abstract: Inflation in the euro area surged to a record 4 percent for the 12 months ending in June, fueling a debate about whether several interest rate hikes are now necessary.
snippet: Inflation in the euro area surged to a record 4 percent for the 12 months ending in June, fueling a debate about whether several interest rate hikes are now necessary.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  Inflation in the euro area surged to a record high for 12 months ending in June, Eurostat, the European statistics agency, reported Monday, inciting a debate about whether the European Central Bank should raise interest rates more than once to keep higher costs from harming the European economy.

headline.main: Inflation in Europe Stirs Debate Over Rates
headline.print_headline: European Inflation Rose To Record High for Year

abstract: It’s official: Bank of America has acquired Countrywide Financial, marking the completion of an audacious rescue of one of the most troubled lenders in the United States. The deal will expand Bank of America’s reach in the mortgage business — but, in the current environment of rising defaults and delinquencies among American homeowners, the expansion obviously comes with serious risks.
lead_paragraph: It’s official: Bank of America has acquired Countrywide Financial, marking the completion of an audacious rescue of one of the most troubled lenders in the United States. The deal will expand Bank of America’s reach in the mortgage business — but, in the current environment of rising defaults and delinquencies among American homeowners, the expansion obviously comes with serious risks.

headline.main: BofA Gets Its Countrywide Deal, for Better or Worse
